intro: Eryngium palmatum, commonly known as sea holly, is a perennial plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its spiky, blue or purple flower heads surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. The plant has a rosette of silver-gray, palmately lobed leaves that are hairy and waxy. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Eryngium palmatum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
